Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Yup, counter in `channelsinfo` works:
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=CCNG channelsopen 027166e21e9579307a1ae4f8c223516e70aae3cbfab4bd6ac7cebfa625dcc0a2a4 10 10000000
```
```
 ./komodo-cli -ac_name=CCNG channelsinfo 2f95b0f4e3dbe7f5ebc0f9479800c9ff3f44e76f5378313c9406ab5a92ff4631
{
  "result": "success",
  "name": "Channel RC3VHbSFQioJsu3xb3qPuEr9dSW3VqZhWj",
  "Open": "10 payments of 10000000 satoshi"
}
```
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=CCNG channelspayment 2f95b0f4e3dbe7f5ebc0f9479800c9ff3f44e76f5378313c9406ab5a92ff4631 10000000```
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=CCNG channelsinfo 2f95b0f4e3dbe7f5ebc0f9479800c9ff3f44e76f5378313c9406ab5a92ff4631
{
  "result": "success",
  "name": "Channel RC3VHbSFQioJsu3xb3qPuEr9dSW3VqZhWj",
  "Open": "10 payments of 10000000 satoshi",
  "Payment": "10000000 satoshi to RUB9qtKwBj4Gt9HY6Vy117AtCdEutVCzCk, 9 payments left"
}
```

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Maybe it is more intuitive to put it on top, or in the global list so it can be known righ away how much is left...

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @Mihailo Why I have to declare `payment_amount` in `channelspayment` call if I can't choose other than I've set in `channelsopen` ?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@Mihailo I think it might be useful for dAPP devs if it'll be in separate parameter in JSON:
Like a: 
```
result:
name:
amount:
wallet:
payments_left:```
And common list like a array of such arrays

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Now it will be hard to parse

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Well, that is good question. I remember once talking with JL should we put amount or number of payments and I think we said at that time that amount is better. But as you say, because you cannot use nothing else except the multiply of denomination set in open, maybe we can but the number of denominations...

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I thought first that ` payment_amount ` determine maximum payment amount but now it determine `only` amount which confused me a little bit while testing

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Basically, what you put in channel open is the denomination you will use for payment. If you want to make exact payments, you open multiple channels with different denominations. For example, one for whole coin, one for 0.1, one for 0.01 and with those thre you can make any X.YZ amount.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Oh I see now

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: There is a limit of 1000 payments per channel. So instead of creating one channel with small denomination and using it for any amount, you make few channels with each denomination you need.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I need to add those checks now to prevent using RPC with invalid arguments.

Content:

It's a test chain, so it doesn't matter. But it got me wondering what a user would do to trace down those coins?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is addresstxids rpc call

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getaddresstxids

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getaddressbalance, etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: given your token address, you can get a list of txid

Content: but if you lost your privkey, you cant do much

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Right, I haven't lost the privkey, but just the pubkey. I should still have all privkeys in my wallet.dat

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then just get the pubkey again

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: So, I should be able to find the pubkey, by iterating through all addresses in my wallet.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Just out of curiosity. Not going to do this.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for CC it is implemented as using the -pubkey= to derive all the CC addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but fundamentally any pubkey can be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and each one generates its own set of related CC addresses

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Ok, so I found the pubkey I was using last time...

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
So, if I wanted to use `tokentransfer` on these tokens, I assume I have to stop the asset chain, switch out for this correct pubkey, and then relaunch. 

Is that the idea?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I don't see anything in `tokentransfer tokenid destpubkey amount` that would otherwise let me choose which pubkey I want to use.

Just trying to understand.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: great. thanks.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this also avoids the need to worry about change addresses

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Yes, that would make it simpler.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: however nothing about the CC prevents multi-pubkey usage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but I think people will find having a vector of addresses for each pubkey confusing enough without needing to deal with a matrix of addresses from a vector of pubkeys

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: especially since things like channels CC creates a new channel address from each pair of pubkeys, we end up with having a cube of possible addresses from the vector of pubkeys for the sender and another for the receiver

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to make things a bit more confusing, tokens are a special case where multiple different CC will support the same token

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: via tokenconvert

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: currently it is just a one way assets -> evalcode conversion, but likely we need to be able to handle the other direction too

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ok, that's a bit over my head. I'll save it in my notes and come back to it when I work on channels.

Another question:

Let's say I launch with a pubkey of an address for which I don't have the private key.

A few questions. First, I'm guessing that this means that if I ask or bid for a token and it is accepted, the tokens will be sent to the indicated pubkey -- is that correct?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it should generate an error if you try to masquerade for a pubkey you dont have

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or at best it will transfer things you can sign to an address you cant spend from

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ok. 

So, to be clear, on an asset chain where I'm not using a pubkey, it's not uncommon to launch with a pubkey that may not be mine. 

For example, this might be a way to donate mining rewards to the developer or something. Is that correct?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is a -donate option for rewards

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i guess if it works, then yes you can do that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure how common this would be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ALL change goes to the pubkey address

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: I just remember reading something about this while reworking docs. I think it was in the zcash default docs.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it wont be long before all your funds end up  in the pubkey address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: NOT recommended

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ooh, okay. I may be misremembering.

So, could we say instead, that under normal circumstances, a user launching with a `-pubkey` parameter active should make sure that they own the privkey to that pubkey?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: That's something I will probably go back and add to the notes...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, i probably should just not allow it, but there might be some cases where that is useful

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the burden of not burning your funds is up to the cli user

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Ok, I was misremembering.

Here's what's in the basic api right now:

```
pubkey
------

``pubkey`` sets an address to use as a change address for all transactions. This value must be set to a 33 byte pubkey. All mined coins will also be sent to this address.

Usage:

As a default value in the coin's ``.conf`` file:

::

  pubkey=027dc7b5cfb5efca96674b45e9fda18df069d040b9fd9ff32c35df56005e330392

```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Ok, added some notes about ensuring they have ownership.
